<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetlibraryinfo">TargetLibraryInfo</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Analysis providing branch probability information.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This is a function analysis which provides information on the relative</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><Highlight kind="comment">/// probabilities of each &quot;edge&quot; in the function&#39;s CFG where such an edge is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><Highlight kind="comment">/// defined by a pair (PredBlock and an index in the successors). The</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="comment">/// probability of an edge from one block is always relative to the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="comment">/// probabilities of other edges from the block. The probabilites of all edges</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="comment">/// from a block sum to exactly one (100%).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="comment">/// We use a pair (PredBlock and an index in the successors) to uniquely</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><Highlight kind="comment">/// identify an edge, since we can have multiple edges from Src to Dst.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><Highlight kind="comment">/// As an example, we can have a switch which jumps to Dst with value 0 and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><Highlight kind="comment">/// value 10</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Process of computing branch probabilities can be logically viewed as three</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><Highlight kind="comment">/// step process:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><Highlight kind="comment">///   First, if there is a profile information associated with the branch then</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><Highlight kind="comment">/// it is trivially translated to branch probabilities. There is one exception</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><Highlight kind="comment">/// from this rule though. Probabilities for edges leading to &quot;unreachable&quot;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="comment">/// blocks (blocks with the estimated weight not greater than</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><Highlight kind="comment">/// UNREACHABLE&#95;WEIGHT) are evaluated according to static estimation and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><Highlight kind="comment">/// override profile information. If no branch probabilities were calculated</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><Highlight kind="comment">/// on this step then take the next one.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><Highlight kind="comment">///   Second, estimate absolute execution weights for each block based on</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><Highlight kind="comment">/// statically known information. Roots of such information are &quot;cold&quot;,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &quot;unreachable&quot;, &quot;noreturn&quot; and &quot;unwind&quot; blocks. Those blocks get their</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><Highlight kind="comment">/// weights set to BlockExecWeight::COLD, BlockExecWeight::UNREACHABLE,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="comment">/// BlockExecWeight::NORETURN and BlockExecWeight::UNWIND respectively. Then the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><Highlight kind="comment">/// weights are propagated to the other blocks up the domination line. In</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><Highlight kind="comment">/// addition, if all successors have estimated weights set then maximum of these</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><Highlight kind="comment">/// weights assigned to the block itself (while this is not ideal heuristic in</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><Highlight kind="comment">/// theory it&#39;s simple and works reasonably well in most cases) and the process</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><Highlight kind="comment">/// repeats. Once the process of weights propagation converges branch</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><Highlight kind="comment">/// probabilities are set for all such branches that have at least one successor</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><Highlight kind="comment">/// with the weight set. Default execution weight (BlockExecWeight::DEFAULT) is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="comment">/// used for any successors which doesn&#39;t have its weight set. For loop back</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><Highlight kind="comment">/// branches we use their weights scaled by loop trip count equal to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &#39;LBH&#95;TAKEN&#95;WEIGHT/LBH&#95;NOTTAKEN&#95;WEIGHT&#39;.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Here is a simple example demonstrating how the described algorithm works.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="comment">///          BB1</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="comment">///         /   \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><Highlight kind="comment">///        v     v</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="comment">///      BB2     BB3</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><Highlight kind="comment">///     /   \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><Highlight kind="comment">///    v     v</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="comment">///  ColdBB  UnreachBB</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Initially, ColdBB is associated with COLD&#95;WEIGHT and UnreachBB with</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="comment">/// UNREACHABLE&#95;WEIGHT. COLD&#95;WEIGHT is set to BB2 as maximum between its</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="comment">/// successors. BB1 and BB3 has no explicit estimated weights and assumed to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="comment">/// have DEFAULT&#95;WEIGHT. Based on assigned weights branches will have the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="comment">/// following probabilities:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="comment">/// P(BB1-&gt;BB2) = COLD&#95;WEIGHT/(COLD&#95;WEIGHT + DEFAULT&#95;WEIGHT) =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="comment">///   65535 / (0xffff + 0xfffff) = 0.0588(5.9%)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="comment">/// P(BB1-&gt;BB3) = DEFAULT&#95;WEIGHT&#95;WEIGHT/(COLD&#95;WEIGHT + DEFAULT&#95;WEIGHT) =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="comment">///          1048575 / (0xffff + 0xfffff) = 0.941(94.1%)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><Highlight kind="comment">/// P(BB2-&gt;ColdBB) = COLD&#95;WEIGHT/(COLD&#95;WEIGHT + UNREACHABLE&#95;WEIGHT) = 1(100%)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="comment">/// P(BB2-&gt;UnreachBB) =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="comment">///   UNREACHABLE&#95;WEIGHT/(COLD&#95;WEIGHT+UNREACHABLE&#95;WEIGHT) = 0(0%)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If no branch probabilities were calculated on this step then take the next</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="comment">/// one.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="comment">///   Third, apply different kinds of local heuristics for each individual</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="comment">/// branch until first match. For example probability of a pointer to be null is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="comment">/// estimated as PH&#95;TAKEN&#95;WEIGHT/(PH&#95;TAKEN&#95;WEIGHT + PH&#95;NONTAKEN&#95;WEIGHT). If</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="comment">/// no local heuristic has been matched then branch is left with no explicit</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="comment">/// probability set and assumed to have default probability.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/branchprobabilityinfo"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/branchprobabilityinfo/#a771cb111ac312594590e53c1f3699fda">BranchProbabilityInfo</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/branchprobabilityinfo/#a771cb111ac312594590e53c1f3699fda"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/branchprobabilityinfo/#a771cb111ac312594590e53c1f3699fda">BranchProbabilityInfo</a>() = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">default</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/branchprobabilityinfo/#ad18bab54d5bb7925300874713924714b"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/branchprobabilityinfo/#ad18bab54d5bb7925300874713924714b">BranchProbabilityInfo</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopinfo">LoopInfo</a> &amp;LI,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="normal">                        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetlibraryinfo">TargetLibraryInfo</a> &#42;TLI = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><Highlight kind="normal">                        <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dominatortree">DominatorTree</a> &#42;DT = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Get an edge&#39;s probability, relative to other out-edges of the Src.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This routine provides access to the fractional probability between zero</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// (0%) and one (100%) of this edge executing, relative to other edges</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// leaving the &#39;Src&#39; block. The returned probability is never zero, and can</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// only be one if the source block has only one successor.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Data structure to track SCCs for handling irreducible loops.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/branchprobabilityinfo/sccinfo"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/branchprobabilityinfo/sccinfo/#adb1204788a33211be05a6a01356e78d0">SccInfo</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Enum of types to classify basic blocks in SCC. Basic block belonging to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// SCC is &#39;Inner&#39; until it is either &#39;Header&#39; or &#39;Exiting&#39;. Note that a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// basic block can be &#39;Header&#39; and &#39;Exiting&#39; at the same time.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">enum</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SccBlockType &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><Highlight kind="normal">      Inner = 0x0,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><Highlight kind="normal">      Header = 0x1,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><Highlight kind="normal">      Exiting = 0x2,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Map of basic blocks to SCC IDs they belong to. If basic block doesn&#39;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// belong to any SCC it is not in the map.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="225"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">using </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">SccMap = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemap">DenseMap&lt;const BasicBlock &#42;, int&gt;</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="226"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Each basic block in SCC is attributed with one or several types from</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="227"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// SccBlockType. Map value has uint32&#95;t type (instead of SccBlockType)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="228"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// since basic block may be for example &quot;Header&quot; and &quot;Exiting&quot; at the same</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="229"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// time and we need to be able to keep more than one value from</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="230"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// SccBlockType.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
